page.title: 18ALL HALLOWS CHURCH
page.content: The church at Mealsgate is dedicated to All Hallows. It was built in 1898-9. It is built of stone in the Norman style. There is a small chancel, a nave, south porch, small vestry and a tower at the west end which contains two bells. There is seating for 112 people. Attached to the church is a mortuary chapel built by George Moore. There is a graveyard surrounding the church, still in use, and in the graveyard a stone cross as a war memorial to the men who died in the 1914-18 war. The parish no longer supports its own vicar, but shares with St. Michael's at Torpenhow. Rev. David Scott is also a noted poet and writer. The vicarage, opposite the church, was sold and is now a private residence.
